alert.note: Alert for Cameron Island; Coastal Cameron; Coastal Kenedy; Coastal Willacy; Inland Cameron; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Kenedy Island; Northern Hidalgo; Southern Hidalgo; Willacy Island (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 02 at 4:21PM CST until March 03 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...ELEVATED TO CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS POSSIBLE FOR ALL OF DEEP SOUTH TEXAS AND THE RIO GRANDE VALLEY LATE THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... .A strong cold front will bring lower humidity and gusty northwesterly winds tonight into early Friday morning. When combined with cured fuels and moderate to severe drought conditions, this could lead to the rapid and erratic spread of wildfires tonight. Conditions improve later Friday morning as winds diminish. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM CST FRIDAY FOR THE MIDDLE AND LOWER RIO GRANDE VALLEY FOR STRONG WINDS, CURED FUELS, AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES... * AFFECTED AREA...Inland Kenedy, Southern Hidalgo, Inland Willacy, Inland Cameron, Coastal Kenedy, Northern Hidalgo, Coastal Willacy, Coastal Cameron, Kenedy Island, Willacy Island and Cameron Island. * TIMING... 10 PM this evening to 9 AM Friday. * WINDS...Northwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 14 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the mid 60s. * LIGHTNING...Very low chance. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
